description:
In battle, there are no equals.

Unmatched is a highly asymmetrical miniature fighting game for two or four players. Each hero is represented by a unique deck designed to evoke their style and legend. Tactical movement and no-luck combat resolution create a unique play experience that rewards expertise, but just when you've mastered one set, new heroes arrive to provide all new match-ups.

Battle of Legends, Volume Two features four heroes: Yennenga, Achilles, Sun Wukong, and Bloody Mary.

Combat is resolved quickly by comparing attack and defense cards. However, each card's unique effects and a simple but deep timing system lead to interesting decisions each time. The game also features an updated version of the line-of-sight system from Tannhäuser for ranged attacks and area effects.

The game includes a new battlefield with a brand new mechanism, pre-washed miniatures for each hero, and custom life trackers that's brought to life with the stunning artwork of Zoe van Dijk and the combined design teams of Restoration Games and Mondo Games.

—description from the publisher

Hiding Hitler is a turn based card-game with a simple objective. End the game with the Hitler card in your hand or be the player to have eliminated him last.

To achieve this goal, you will use a mixture of Action, Attack, and Instant cards. Action cards provide various utility methods such as drawing cards, stealing cards, or peaking into the deck. Attack cards are how a player attempts to eliminate Hitler. Instant cards are special because they can be played at any time. They can strengthen, weaken, or redirect an attack to another player. A turn consists of unlimited actions, unlimited instants, up to 1 attack and concludes with drawing a card.

Deal or Death is the negotiation-focused social deduction game about corporate absurdity. Haggle and form coalitions in a series of fast-paced negotiations, while facing the constant threat of betrayal. As Executives attempt to secure the support of Shareholders by promising some coveted paperclips, Infiltrators with hidden agendas will do whatever it takes to fulfill their own ambitions. Who can you trust to make you rich?

After players draw their roles, the Executives shall identify themselves while the roles of the remaining players, known as the Board Members, remain hidden. Each Executive then enters a two-minute negotiation with every Board Member, offering Paperclips in exchange for information and support with the hope of closing Deals with Shareholders during the Board Meeting at the end of the game. Shareholders must decide which Executive to side with and close the most lucrative Deal, while Infiltrators disrupt negotiations with their own goals.

While negotiations are occurring, the other players are free to network, strategizing and scheming with each other. Before the Board Meeting begins, Board Members can discover someone else's role through a Disclosure (provided by Shareholder Tokens, Infiltrator Tokens, and VP Stars). Once the Executives finish negotiating with each Board Member, they may negotiate with one player for the second time in the Endgame Negotiations.

In the Board Meeting that follows, Executives and Shareholders shall submit Proposals, outlining the terms that they are committed to. Executives write down which of their Paperclips will go to who, while Shareholders write down their expected payout and which Executive they are supporting. Terms need to match in order for a Deal to close, but Executives may give more Paperclips than what a Shareholder asks for in their Proposal. Once they are done, players will reveal their Proposals and see who has closed Deals and who has won.

-description from publisher

There’s somethin’ in the town of Backwater that don’t belong. It fills the air with energy, like it feels before a storm. Except this storm ain’t one of wind and rain, but bullets and blood.

King of the West is a weird west themed area control card game. Three different sets of characters will be available at launch. One set can be played as a 2-3 player 18-card area control game, but multiple sets will allow for up to 9 players with the modified rules variant.

For the area control variant setup, nine building cards are randomly played on a 3x3 grid to make up the town. Six buildings are generic locations and the other three are the unique target locations. Since they are played randomly, the location of these target buildings will be different in every game.

Players can take three actions on their turn: Claim a Building, Move, and Shootout! Shootouts are how you remove opponents from the buildings you want. You do this by trying to get into your opponent's head and outthink them using a nuanced rock-paper-scissors combat system.

The game ends when either a player starts their turn controlling all three target locations or they are the only player controlling any buildings in the town.

With multiple sets and a larger player count, your still fighting over buildings, but instead of gaining a new location every turn, you are limited to what you start with. Players can't be eliminated though and when you run out of your buildings, you can steal someone elses. Other than that, combat works in the same way and the winner is the last person (or team!) left with claimed buildings.

—description from the designer


King of the West' card game set 2: The Mavericks, including The Marshall, The Bartender, The Wolf, and their locations.

The board is a tennis court with holes in a grid of 4x6 for each half of the court. Players use small plastic tennis rackets to catapult cones into the court. Points differ by the area of the court the cones fall at, e.g. left and right service box is 5 points.

The players becomes the characters of "Dr. Stone" and cooperates to achieve the purpose of each episode. There are many mysteries and surprises during the game, and you can solve them by combining materials and making equipment to find ways to achieve your goals.

It is a story driven cooperative game that can be enjoyed not only by those who watch the anime or read the manga, but also by those who haven't watched it.

The purpose of the game is to create a "goal item" in each episode within the time limit. In a world that has lost science, casual things doesn't seem to fulfill a purpose. However, with the knowledge of Senku and the cooperation of his friends, there is nothing impossible!

The players start at the large space with the arrow. The first player to reach the large space with the black dot wins the game. Direction of movement is determined by a die. The players move 1 space per turn. If a meeple gets on an occupied space, the the first meeple is returned to the starting space.

Inspired by Cards Against Humanity (and with their blessing) comes Karty DÅ¼entelmenów ("Gentlemen Cards"). This is a polish spin-off of CAH and the cards are dual language (Polish and English).

Episode 5 consists of 220 new cards:

     50 new Black Cards of questions
     160 new White Cards of answers
     10 blank cards (5 black, 5 white) for Your ideas.
     This game is fully compatible with previous editions


About what is the game? Players draw answer cards to their hand. One person draw question card. In secret everybody add their answer and after shuffle everybody votes on the best/funniest/craziest answer card. The person with the higher number of votes wins the round and take the card to his players area as a point. Than everybody fill answer cards, and the winner draws another question card. You can play how long you want, or determine how much point you need to earn to win the game.

—user summary

PrzekaÅ¼ 100zÅ‚ na fundacjÄ™ dla niewidomych dzieci, które i tak tych pieniÄ™dzy nie zobaczÄ…!

Karty DÅ¼entelmenów: Epizod PiÄ…ty to towarzyska gra karciana przeznaczona dla osób lubiÄ…cych czarny humor bez cenzury! W kaÅ¼dej kolejce DÅ¼entelmen zadaje pytanie z Czarnej Karty, a pozostali odpowiadajÄ… za pomocÄ… swojej najzabawniejszej BiaÅ‚ej Karty. To pierwsza w Polsce dwujÄ™zyczna gra tekstowa tego typu, która umoÅ¼liwia wspólnÄ… zabawÄ™ z anglojÄ™zycznymi znajomymi!

PudeÅ‚ko zawiera 220 kart w tym:

     50 nowych Czarnych Kart pytaÅ„
     160 nowych BiaÅ‚ych Kart odpowiedzi
     10 pustych (5 Czarnych i 5 BiaÅ‚ych) kart na Twoje pomysÅ‚y
     PeÅ‚na kompatybilnoÅ›Ä‡ z pozostaÅ‚ymi czÄ™Å›ciami


—description from the publisher

Generation Y is a new social game with a twist - you will use your smartphones and their features as playing field.


     You are playing around the table with your smartphones
     The game arena is online. A messenger-app of your choosing
     Challenge yourself in over 45 tasks
     Knowledge, talent, creativity and humour will bring you victory


Share your experiences and get a viral hit

—description from the publisher

Generation Y ist ein brandneues Gesellschaftsspiel mit einem innovativen Spielprinzip - ihr nutzt euer Smartphone und dessen unzählige Funktionen als elektronisches Spielinstrument.


     Gespielt wird am heimischen Tisch mit eurem Smartphone
     Die Spielarena ist online. Eine beliebige Messenger-App
     In über 45 Aufgaben fordert ihr euch gegenseitig heraus
     Wissen, Talent, Kreativität und Humor bringen euch den Sieg
     Teilt eure Spielerlebnisse und landet einen viralen Hit


—description from the publisher (German)

This is a short card game for 3-8 players that pushes players to speak and interact with each other in unusual ways, to keep the play entertaining.

Players use cards to force a variety of effects on each other. Many of these have conditions (e.g. "Dance like a sheep for 10 seconds. If you don't, you die.") that must be fulfilled to not be eliminated from the game.

The last player remaining is the winner.

In today's world, where security is a daily challenge and terrorists and serious crime cross borders, having a modern, mobile and flexible army is of paramount importance.

In New Techno War, you will take command of a modern military troop, based on the doctrine of a real army of today, with its equipment, vehicles and real firepower.

In serious scenarios, based on real facts, but also on original and amusing adventures, you will be able to test your tactics to achieve maximum success in a mission.

In order to optimize your chances, this game proposes to introduce into the troops modern technologies, still in test phase, or non-existent. These extensions should allow you to refine or even reinforce your actions. In the basic box, you will already find the new technology of the exoskeleton.

From the award-winning, best-selling creators of Exploding Kittens and Throw Throw Burrito, A Little Wordy is a fresh and ridiculously clever take on the genre of tile-based word-unscrambling games.

Here’s how it works: You’re each given a pile of letters. Rearrange your letters until you come up with a word. Be sneaky and choose a word that your opponent won’t easily guess.

Write it down, keep it a secret. Rescramble your tiles, pass them to your opponent. The goal is to examine your opponent’s tiles and try to figure out their word. You do this with Clue Cards. These tell you things such as: what’s the first letter, how long’s the word, or what does it rhyme with? You win by using as FEW of these clue cards as possible to figure out what word your opponent wrote down.

It’s thoughtful, strategic, highly-replayable, and built specifically for two players. It’s not a game about having the mightiest vocabulary - it’s a game about making clever choices.

The longest, most complicated word isn’t always the best choice. Sometimes, picking a smaller, common word is better because your brainiac opponent will overthink things and blaze right past it. Trying to figure out your opponent’s secret word can be both hilarious and (delightfully) maddening. A Little Wordy levels the playing field against veteran word wizards.

-description from publisher

Welcome to Sunny Day Sardines cannery! Competition is tough for the coveted Employee of the Month Award. Do you have what it takes to gather fish and pack the most orders? If so, then you’re hired!

Sunny Day Sardines is a fun and quick pocket sized game where players take turns gathering sardines and using them to complete orders for points. Whoever has the most points at the end of the game wins and is named the Employee of the Month at the Sunny Day Sardines cannery.

This travel size game even comes in a metal tin! Sunny Day Sardines is a family fun game with easy to learn rules suitable for all ages.

Game play is quick to explain and get right to playing. Let's find out how:
On a player's turn they can do one of two things: collect two fish from the market (two different single fish cards or one double fish card) OR turn in fish they've already collected to complete order cards from the display. Players will take turns until the last order card is placed into the display, then finish the round. Most points from collected order cards wins!

-description from publisher

On the verge of extinction, after years of conflict that has left their planet nearly depleted of its natural resources, the inhabitants of this world have no choice but to leave their home. They’ll accomplish this by using advanced long range spacecraft to journey to the nearest habitable world that will become their new home.


Still stubbornly divided after decades of fighting, the remaining world powers now engage in a final surge for dominance and self preservation as they race ahead to their objective. As time runs out, they now must make a hasty departure from their dying planet. In order to complete their mission, they must obtain the materials necessary to sustain themselves, maintain their spacecraft, and research the science required to navigate their way through the long and dangerous journey that awaits them. In an ironic twist, they may be forced to cooperate with one another while still protecting their own interests. Now the ultimate strategic gamble for survival will require you to be the first to arrive and claim the distant world TERRA PROXIMA...

Terra Proxima, by Bavarian Games, is a push-your-luck, resource management game that will keep you on the edge of your seat throughout gameplay! It’s intense enough to keep experienced gamers excited, but simple enough to be enjoyable regardless of a player’s skill-set! In Terra Proxima, players will travel to different Moons and Planets to gather necessary materials and research the science in order to continue their journey towards Terra Proxima at the center of the board. The first player to arrive on Terra Proxima is the winner of the game. Will you be able to get there first?

—description from the designer

This game was never published due to series being cancelled.

The time is set for Operation Barbarossa and the greatest tank battle of all times: more than 3.000 Soviet and nearly 700 German tanks and assault guns will clash in Soviet occupied Southern Poland. Known as the Battle of Brody-Dubno-Lutsk, that bloody triangle saw the direst straits of invading German forces in Barbarossa as they struggle for a week to repel the massive Soviet armored counterattacks to the flanks of the spearhead formed by Ewald Kleist's 1st Panzergruppe. German invasion force was aimed towards Kyiv and the Kyiv Special Military District was the better armed and prepared of all Soviet Fronts stationed on the Westerns borders of the URSS, with a full array of Soviet Mechanized Corps, equipped with hundreds of the new brand tanks KV and T-34. As the German player you control two powerful German armies: 6th and 1st Panzergruppe. The Soviet player will control the Northern flank of the Southwestern Front –formed by the 5th and 6th all arms armies. Blocks are mostly divisions with some regiments/brigades and German Kampfgruppen.

In DUBNO’41 you will see, with a minimum of new rules, the Soviet unpreparedness for war in June 1941 as they desperately struggled for defeating the German invaders. Soviets had a huge amount of low quality units with powerful but fragile armored forces against the Wehrmacht at its peak of quality and efficiency. Not a one-sided battle as someone could think about Operation Barbarossa but the Soviets could accomplish their mission and defeat or at least stop the invaders. The game includes assets for minor but powerful German units as the elite 652nd Panzerjaeger battalion or the scarce panzer grenadiers units fully equipped with armored carrier vehicles, heavy artillery, anti-tank units, the all-known 88’s cannons and more. Events include Soviet extra-hard KV and T-34 tanks, flamethrower tanks, air attacks, Soviet mechanical breakdowns and political officers and more…

German swiftness and tactical ability is opposed to Soviet mass and technological advantage. Weirdly not a single Stuka plane would arrive to help the German forces as Army Group South was not equipped with that type of aircraft. Soviet Air Force will fight one of its more desperate battles adding considerable strength to Soviet ground attacks. Will you pierce the Soviet lines and breakout towards Kyiv, or you would slow the German advance and counterattack successfully defeating the invaders?

-description from designer

Axis Mundi is a 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate) mythological-space themed game, in which each player commands one of four worlds: Olympus, Takamagahara, Asgard and Kukultan.

The goal of each player is to become the AXIS MUNDI - the axis of the world - of the intelligent and primitive civilizations of the worlds that populate the galaxy. In this way they will be the hegemonic culture of the galaxy.

A game consists of twelve turns. The game ends at the end of the twelfth turn.

In each turn, each player may perform up to three consecutive actions.

Actions allow movement and combat, the occupation of planets, the exploitation and regeneration of their resources, the deployment of combat units, and the development of one's own civilization on occupied planets.

A player wins if he has more controlled planets than the rest of the players at the end of turn twelve.

—description from the designer (translated)

AXIS MUNDI es un juego de temática mitológico-espacial 3X (Expand, Exploit, Exterminate), en el que cada jugador dirige una de estos cuatro mundos: Olimpo, Takamagahara, Asgard y Kukultán.

El objetivo de cada jugador es convertirse en el AXIS MUNDI –el eje del mundo- de las civilizaciones inteligentes y primitivas de los mundos que pueblan la galaxia. De este modo serán la cultura hegemónica de la galaxia.

Una partida consta de doce turnos. La partida finaliza al concluir el turno doce.

En cada turno, cada jugador podrá llevar a cabo hasta tres acciones consecutivas.

Las acciones permiten el movimiento y combate, la ocupación de planetas, la explotación y regeneración de sus recursos, el despliegue de unidades de combate, y el desarrollo de la civilización propia en los planetas ocupados.

Un jugador gana si consigue más planetas controlados que el resto de jugadores al finalizar el turno doce.

—description from the designer

This is a redux of a variant of the renaissance-era Game of Goose (1587) which was themed around the era of Kaiser Wilhelm II and created around the year 1888.

According to the German designer Gerald H Kuhlmann, this appeared to be aimed at appealing to supporters of the Hohenozollern dynasty as they transitioned to the reign of young ruler who took his Grandfather's place and inspired hope of generational change.

In this game, 2 to 7 players rely on dice results to move their pieces around a spiral track toward the middle. The player who arrives first receives the tokens placed there at the start. Along the way, special space actions lead to special events, payments or profits.

When that end is achieved each player receives the tokens on the space of the monarch which was their hidden choice at the start. If players have chosen the same the rewards are split evenly. Any unchosen monarch's tokens are then also distributed evenly.

After all of this, the player with the most tokens (money) wins.

—user summary

Thousands of years ago, the Book of Eternity was placed on a bridge with four sacred guardians of white and black magic to defend the balance between the forces of good and evil.

The magic that emanates from the book has sparked an ambition among its guardians who now struggle to the death to reach it and be the holder of the power of the book.

Choose your side and help the guardians to take possession of the Miraculum, the Book of Eternity.

Miraculum is a quick game based on the throw of dice to be played in pairs (2x2) or in duel mode (1x1), where you will have to choose between defending white magic or black magic.

You and your opponents will fight to the death to be the new holder of the holy book, the Miraculum.

Each turn, you will have to combine the result of your dice to be able to cast spells to attack, protect, walk, push, trap, poison, heal, reverse position or even summon a werewolf against your enemies.

There are two ways to win the game:
- Killing all wizards of the opposite color by throwing them off the bridge; or
- Arriving and taking possession of the Book of Eternity, the Miraculum.

Players create and manage a soccer team by moving on a track wich provides events, opportunities to buy team members and challenges with other players. Money is the essential ressource you can gain or lose according to the events. Team members may be sold by negotiation from player to player. The Player to collect all of his 11 team members and owning the most valuable Team, wins the game.

A Soccer game for 2 or 4 players. 4 players play simultaneously two 2 player games on both identical boards.

A soccer match is played by rolling one die and moving one of the 11 pawns on the tracks, eliminating the opponent pawns by requiring the same field and moving one own pawn into the opponents goal. After scoring a goal, the game is reset, every player regains his lost pawns. Play continues until the agreed time is up.

"Toward ten o'clock I could sense an added nervousness. Commanders asked more often
Whether there were any changes." –Yael Dayan’s comments following a command meeting by Sharon and his officers early in the attack at Abu Ageila, June 5, 1967.

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is an introductory-level wargame simulation of the battle of Abu Ageila, fought in the Sinai between the Egyptian 2nd Infantry Division and elements of General Ariel Sharon’s armored Ugdah (division).

Players are cast in the roles of the local commanders on this battlefield.  Both will be challenged to do as well, or better than their historical counterparts.

Each copy of Hot Sand, Cold Steel includes the following:

•    Eighty single-sided, unmounted counters
•    Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
•    One Players’ Aid Sheet
•    8 pages of rules

Players will also need one six-sided die to play the game. Each hex is about three quarters of a kilometer across.  A turn represents two hours of time.  Each unit is either a battalion (II) or company (I).

Hot Sand, Cold Steel is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Tim Allen.

-description from designer

Equatorial Clash is a simulation of the conflict between Ecuador and Perú in July 1941. This small war was the most important clash in the long series of wars, skirmishes and border conflicts between these two countries for the regions that both considered rightfully theirs. The game is centered in the main theatre of operations in the coastal zone.

The game uses a map divided into areas and in each turn players will alternate taking “impulses” in which they can spend a certain amount of “action points” in order to move military units, launch combats, replenish depleted units and influence in political matters. The other fronts of the war are represented in a more abstract way as two tracks: one for the Macará-Loja axis and another one for the Amazonian outposts as a whole.

—description from the designer

Set during the Victorian era in the English town of Blackbrim, you are a private detective who has received a package containing mysterious clues from a police commissioner shortly before he was kidnapped. He and the entire police force are being held hostage. To save them, you must solve all the riddles the perpetrator left behind…

Blackbrim: 1876 contains one full storyline made up of two parts, with dozens of clues to crack and riddles to solve. Play with a group or on your own for hours of fun. It's like two escape room or mystery games with one single purchase.
A victorian game of skill.  Players try to roll their oblong tumbler into the hole for the highest points without losing it off the board.
A dexterity game where players throw marbles and try to be the first to 10,000 points.
Players set a top spinning in the center of the board. If the top starts a spinner to move, player scores the points shown.  Player with the highest total wins.

A new card game for people who probably need therapy and who love to laugh. (Ahem, everyone!)

Take turns playing "Doc" as players prescribe and treat some modern day ailments with comical solutions. Strengthen your funny bones and see who's the best at helping one another get through life.

The dealer (AKA the “Doc”) starts by dealing each player seven Freud cards. The Doc then draws a Party card and reads it aloud. The Party card will present a modern day ailment.

Players then choose from a range of fake treatment options through the Freud cards and toss them into a pile. The Doc then reads the fake treatment options aloud and chooses their favorite prescription. Plus, our Group Therapy prompts are hidden within the Party cards.

Group Therapy activities include:

     Symptom Charades: Using the rules of charades, players act out a range of mood related ailments.
     Rapid Response: Similar to categories, players shout out words to fit within a certain category.
     Diagnose a Friend: Players identify who amongst the group fits a certain description.
     Head Talk: The Doc places a card on their for head and players shout out clues as fast as possible to compete for the most helpful assistant. 


—description from the designer

Quests: Heroes of Sorcado is an epic  fantasy cooperative campaign for 1-6 players.  In each of eight adventures (plus a bonus training adventure) you'll  build your character, acquiring powerful spells and weapons, and increasing your abilities by defeating monsters, evading traps, and forging your path through choice-driven events, traps, and side quests.

Add up your Hero's character, weapon, and magic bonuses, and roll dice for damage against fearsome foes, with each Adventure culminating in a boss fight that will require all your best items, potions, abilities, and a bit of luck.  With a 60+ page campaign story and 140+ pages of additional story events and choices, players can immerse themselves in a world beset by a demon lord bent on total destruction.  Choose your destiny, hone your weapons, and find out if you have what it takes to save Sorcado from utter destruction at the hands of the Dark Lord.

				
				
					-=-=-=-You can try the Demo/Prequel adventure on TableTop Simulator : https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2435363148
Explore the city of Washington DC, exploring the nation's monuments and museum as you track down a secret society and stop their evil plans in this at-home escape room.

Discover the famous belote games in its Junior version!

     With 4 game rules to learn Belote and its variants!
     Let your children discover the games of your childhood!
     From 6 years old. From 2 to 6 players.

The popularity of the world's kittens is in jeopardy, so they decide to disguise themselves as other more fashionable creatures in an attempt to regain their appeal. In this original, exciting and highly addictive game, your aim is to become top cat, by maximizing your visibility and concealing your opponents. Become the world's top trending kitten!

Trending kittens is a tile game where you have to place your tiles on the table in order to flip the tiles of the other players upside down and yours facing up. At the end of the game, the one with the most tiles facing up will be the winning cat.

In addition, once during the game, you can use your clan power, making the game much more fun and difficult for your opponents.

Will you be the most "trendy" cat?

-description from designer

It's a race across the country as you pilot your cargo plane, earning points as you make your deliveries. Pick your routes to be the quickest and most efficient.

There are two types of cards in the game. Route cards show a potential cargo delivery route, displaying a PICKUP AIRPORT and a DELIVERY AIRPORT, and also the point value of the route once completed. Action cards can be either GREEN - which benefit the player playing the card and RED - which negatively affect an opponent who receives the card.

Play begins with a number of unclaimed route cards equal to the number of players plus three. These are available to all players.

On their turn, the player does two things. First is the movement phase, where the player rolls the dice and moves their airplane token. Airport spaces must be avoided unless the player intends on "landing" there. Once on an airport space, that player claims an associated route card with that airport as the PICKUP AIRPORT. The goal is now to complete that Route card as quickly as possible by moving on subsequent turns to the DESTINATION AIRPORT indicated on the claimed card. Once the DESTINATION AIRPORT is landed on, the player claims the associated points and now may chase another route to gain more points.

The second part of one's turn is comprised of playing one action card if the payer chooses to. Follow the card (either GREEN or RED) instructions. Then play moves to the next person in a clockwise direction.

First player to earn 20 points is the winner.

Il gioco del contrabbandiere, the Smuggler's Game.

The protagonists of this game are the "financiers" (finanza) and smugglers (contrabbandiere) who, especially from the 50s to the 70s have marked the history, economy and culture of the Como and Ticino area in Lombardy, Italy and Switzerland.

The Smugglers get 3 pawns, the financier brigadier 3 as well. Movements are from 1 point to another.

The Smugglers win if two of them reach a Warehouse on the Italian side.
The Financiers win by catching two Smugglers.

In this game there are no dice, this gives ample space to strategy. In addition there are "event" cards to make sure that everything can change until the last move.

Various adventurers throw themselves into dangerous dens of monsters. The vile monsters are guarding numerous gold coins and treasures, the humans are no match of them – but luckily the monsters get dizzy and fall asleep! Dear adventurers, you must be very quiet when picking up treasures, and remember the other players are not your true friends!

Players use action cards to pick up treasure cards on a map built up with unused monster cards. During planning phrase, players choose (aka plan) action cards face down from his hand. Planned action cards are resolved during resolve phrase according to the speed factor on them. Also, different action cards will cause different level of noises, which accumulates and maybe loud enough to wake the monster:

Dizzy-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) it is facing
Angry-waken monster will attack the direction (and all characters there) where it is the nosiest
Monster attacks will cause affected characters drop a lot of treasures they previously got!

Treasure cards after being picked up go to that player’s bag, so do the action cards after used. Later when you replenish your hand from the bag, you got the some unable-to-use-as-action treasure cards instead of action cards. But you can choose THROW A TREASURE at another player to make some huge noise there! Of course you can choose to put a too-valuable-to-give-up treasure back into your bag…

The monster will eventually fully wake and players will evacuate from the den. The player with the highest total value of treasure wins the game!

In a remote place there is a Pyramid that hides in its interior a Dazzling Treasure. Four Peoples embarked, a long time ago, on their search. The People of the Valley, the People of the Forest, the People of the Mountain, and the People of Space. Four lonely heroes, bored of being so lonely, decided to join the quest: the skeleton, the robot, the barbarian and the mermaid.
Thus was born the authentic and original... Mutant Deck I

—description from the publisher (translated)

In this game, we will become adorable little monkeys who like to move non-stop.

The players will take a card from the deck and imitate the movement indicated on it. The next player will draw a new card and must imitate both the previous movement and the new one that he has chosen. Each player must repeat all the previous movements in the same order.

If a player forgets a move or does them in the wrong order, they are eliminated from the game.  The last person standing wins.

There are 32 cards with 8 different types of monkeys.

Looking for a fast-paced, easy to learn, crowd-pleasing game? This That & Everything: Popular Culture is about all things related to the entirety of ideas, perspectives, attitudes, images, and other phenomena that is considered popular.

In this rapid-fire game, players race to describe people, places, and things related to pop culture for their teammates to guess. Doesn't sound like much of a challenge? Try to describe all 6 in 30 seconds!

Contents: 100 Double-Sided Cards, Score Pad, 30-Second Sand Timer

Collect resources to arrange venues and invite people for the best parties in town.

Each turn you select one of two drawn resources. When you have enough resources you can use them to either prepare for parties or move to/arrange new venues.

You score points based on the number of invitations sent during preparation and the number of venues arranged.

—description from the designer

2 auto race games on a double-sided board.  Both use the same flip mechanic where players flip a disc to land on the space they want to move to or the circle which contains the number of spaces to move (depending on board) and try to avoid the spaces with road hazards. First to the end of the board wins.

Components 
4 cars
2 flip sticks (Tongue depressors or popsicle sticks)
1 double-sided board
Rules

a cooperative 3D Tower Defense game.

Try and stop the conquistadors from entering and destroying the Bacab Temple. 
Work together simultaneous as a team to manipulate the tower, upgrade the weapons and turn each section for maximum damage.
Survive the onslaught for 6 or 8 rounds to win the game.

Each round has 7 phases

1. Building phase: 
Build new weapons or abilities onto the tower
Research the next level of your abilities 
Upgrade abilities on the tower to a next level

2. Turning phase:
Pass resources to other players by putting resources on the top of the tower
Decide as a group which levels of the tower to turn. To give each player the best fighting chance to win the next attack.

3.Second building phase:
Now the tower levels have turned, a new building opportunity has risen.

4. Attack phase:
Everybody can now attack the conquistadors in front of him, using the damage and abilities on the tower.

5. Resource phase:
Each player looks at the resource abilities on the tower on his side and multiply them by the same resource regions on his part of the battle map.

6. Move conquistadors phase:
Move all the conquistadors that are still alive one space closer to the tower. If they would enter the tower the game is lost.

7. Spawn phase:
Each player spawns 2 new conquistadors on his side of the board.

-description from designer

The principle of the game is quite simple: each player must perform the numbers indicated on cards drawn at random at the start of the game. For that he places numbered pawns on the board he is going to add. The combinations can be crossed on the board, each result being obtained horizontally or vertically.
Players score points for each combination by adding the number of tokens used to the value of the combination made. Whoever has the most points wins.

—user summary

Once upon a time there was an enchanted forest in a magical land where a playful lioness cub happened upon a storybook with the most wonderful tales. Little lioness imagined herself as the main character with a flowing cape and super strength. She showed the book to all her creature friends, who also dreamed of what it would be like to be one of these fabled names. What if all critters could become their favorite characters? With Character Critters game, you can help them reach this dream!

Character Critters is an imaginative drawing game for the whole family. Every round, each player receives a random Character Card and Critter Card and draws the Critter in the style of the Character. What would a horse look like as Rapunzel? How about a kangaroo Santa Claus? Players draw their Character Critters simultaneously and earn points by guessing drawings correctly and having their drawings correctly guessed. There are also Jr. Character cards included for younger players so they can conjure up a scientist penguin or a frog who’s a clown. With over 4,000 possible card combinations, you’ll flex your creativity and make some delightfully unique art each time you play!

—description from the designer

The Hungry Trucker Cafe is under new management and you’ve being hired as its chef. The new menu features all the greasy spoon favourites, as well as a few healthier dishes in an attempt to attract the more discerning clientele.

You'll need to make regular visits to the local market to ensure that your fridge is well stocked with the best ingredients. And Get all the food orders out on time, otherwise you’ll be faced with very hungry, even furious, customers!

The game uses different coloured dice to represent different ingredients. The value of a die will indicate how fresh the ingredient is and this reduces each turn.

Choose ingredients from a pool of dice (the market) to add to your fridge (a bag). Randomly draw ingredients and place them onto the cards to complete orders, avoid penalties and gain rewards. A completed order also gives you a single use special action.

Can you complete enough orders to be awarded "Employee of the Month?".

An entry in the 2021 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest

—description from the designer

Command an elite group of death-defying spaceships desperately harvesting energy from a dying star before it explodes in this game of orbital mechanics. Utilizing a unique spiral gameboard inspired by the ancient Egyptian game of Mehen (previously reconstructed and released by the same game designer, Zach Horton), Supernova requires you to make tough choices, as all of your ships must share the same energy allotment, and it is never enough to power them all at once.  The more you power, the fewer Boost Points each one receives, restricting its maneuverability.  This is a high-stakes tradeoff, as the star's gravity pulls all of your ships ever closer. You'll need to boost your orbits to keep from burning up.

Ships move in a counterclockwise spiral toward the star at the center, while the star releases energy bursts (cubes) that travel clockwise toward the edges of the board.  The core of the game lies in the interactions between the energy cubes and ships as they collide.  Different types of cubes behave differently, but all are dangerous and all are valuable if you can capture them.  Clear and yellow cubes can be stored and used as energy to perform special actions, while yellow and red cubes count as victory points at the end of the game.  These energy cubes serve as your primary obstacles, primary goal, in-game currency, and victory points.

Players take turns deciding how many ships to power and then moving each one according to both gravity and Boost Points.  Ships can form special formations to help protect them, block your opponents, and collect energy cubes.  After players have taken their turns, each round ends with a "star action" that moves the cubes on the board and releases new ones.  The sequence of star actions is determined by randomly drawing cards when you set up the game.  Thus every game is completely different.  Players can only see the star cards for the current and next rounds, and therefore have limited information about future conditions.  Despite this element of long-term uncertainty, however, there is no other luck in the game.  Players have complete control over the outcomes of their actions.

Supernova is relatively easy to play, but exceptionally difficult to master, as it asks you to think in spiral rather than linear geometry.  The game's mechanics offer many possible ways to achieve your goals, but far more options become available when you begin to work with rather than against the spiral: sometimes the most efficient path from A to B is the long way around...

—description from the publisher

Salvo! Denmark Strait is a solitaire WW2 naval war game containing rules, game tables and war ships simulating The Battle of Denmark Strait in May, 1941. You'll need three dice (d6), paper and a pencil to play. Ship counters are included.

Extra warships allow for various "what if?" situations to be explored.

This game is part of Minden Games' 4 Naval WW2 Solitaire Games Bundle and is a companion game to Minden's Salvo! River Plate.

From an abandoned mountain fortress you command a group of Norwegian volunteers fighting numerically superior German forces in the early days of WW2.

Halls of Hegra is a solitaire-only wargame in the same vein as "Robinson Crusoe", "This War of Mine" and "Dead of Winter". The mechanics are worker placement, bag building, and area control/ tower defense.

You play as the commander of the Norwegian forces during the three stages of the game.

1. Mobilization. 
Explore the fortress while you dig your way through mountains of snow and broken equipment. New recruits are joining your growing force while you plan supply routes for the coming siege.

2. 1st. attack 
The village below the fortress is attacked. You try to defend it while you do the final preparations before the Siege. Send out patrols behind enemy lines to secure enough supplies.

3. Siege 
The Siege of fortress Hegra begins. You have to endure constant bombing and infantry attack while keeping the morale up amongst your men. Will you survive?

—description from the designer

Players must be the first to spin their way to Mother Goose by matching the color on the spinner to the color of the track.

Board and rules are printed in box

Based on a traditional outdoor game.

In Long donkey players are divided into two teams. Each team has 4 pawns and one donkey with 8 card slots. Each card slot on the donkeys is divided into two parts: The defense area and the attack area.

The pawns of each team are “climbing” on the attack area of the opposite’s team donkey based on their jump cards. The other team must put a defense card on their donkey’s defense area.

Every slot of a team’s donkey has 1 stamina value by default. 
Every single pawn burdens a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 1 weight value. No defense card needed on that slot by the defending team.

Every 2 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 4 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +4 defense card on that slot.

Every 3 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 9 weight value. The defending team needs at least a +8 defense card on that slot.

Every 4 pawns burden a slot of the opposite team’s donkey by 16 weight value. The defending team needs at least the +2 +6 +8 defense cards on that slot.

The end of the game:
When there is less stamina value than the opponent’s weight value on a single slot of a donkey at the end of the turn, the attacking team wins the game!

-description from designer

Game of double Six. After having staked for the pool, the players throw two dice and he who has the most points, begins. The dice under the figures show the number of points, whereas the numbers at the top indicate how much a player shall receive from or pay to the pool. The white stars win, the black stars lose. If a player throws 2 points, he gets half the pool but loses a turn. On the throw of 12 points, the player wins the game and the pool and is the starting player for the next game.

—user summary
